Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server

Class PlayerHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.PlayerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControlBase, Runnable
public class PlayerHandler extends Object implements Runnable, ControlBase
This class manages the direct talk with the player, every exchanged message between client and server has to pass from here

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PlayerHandler​(Socket socket)
    Generates a PlayerHandler

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    disconnection()
    Disconnects the player associated with this player handler -> if the player was previously in game, set the player disconnected and notify the other players, if it was his turn switch to the next player, if he will try to reconnect he could restart from where he left -> otherwise remove globally the nickname associated with the player
    void
    endGame()
    Method called at the end of the match -> if this method is called the match has comes naturally to an end and the player can be disconnected without issues
    StateName
    getCurrentState()

    getPlayer()
     
    Timer
    heartbeat()
    Creates a thread that periodically calls keepAlive() to keep alive the connection with the client until he give us a valid nickname
    void
    keepAlive()
    Keeps alive the connection with the client sending a ping
    void
    run()
    Handles the communication with the client, reading the messages from the socket and redistributing them to the correct controller until the connection drops or the play session comes to an end.
    void
    setMatchController​(MatchController matchController)
    Links the match controller to this client, when this method is called the client is considered in the match and so he will accept different types of messages
    void
    setPlayer​(Player player)
    Sets the player related to this client
    boolean
    write​(StoCMessage msg)
    Writes something at this player, the message has to be written in json in the correct format

      Description copied from interface: ControlBase
      Links the match controller to this client, when this method is called the client is considered in the match and so he will accept different types of messages

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Description copied from interface: ControlBase
      Method called at the end of the match -> if this method is called the match has comes naturally to an end and the player can be disconnected without issues
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface ControlBase

    • run

      public void run()
      Handles the communication with the client, reading the messages from the socket and redistributing them to the correct controller until the connection drops or the play session comes to an end. If the player disconnects, this thread run comes to an end but the instance remains saved in ServerUtilities ready to be used for reconnection issues
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • write

      public boolean write​(StoCMessage msg)
      Writes something at this player, the message has to be written in json in the correct format
      Specified by:
      write in interface ControlBase
      Parameters:
      msg - the message you want to send to this player
      Returns:
      true if the message has been sent, false if something goes wrong in the output stream

    • heartbeat

      public Timer heartbeat()
      Creates a thread that periodically calls keepAlive() to keep alive the connection with the client until he give us a valid nickname
      Returns:
      the Timer that has to be canceled when the player give us a valid nickname

    • keepAlive

      public void keepAlive()
      Keeps alive the connection with the client sending a ping

    • disconnection

      public void disconnection()
      Disconnects the player associated with this player handler -> if the player was previously in game, set the player disconnected and notify the other players, if it was his turn switch to the next player, if he will try to reconnect he could restart from where he left -> otherwise remove globally the nickname associated with the player
